AID00126758	It dedicated its citizens to something higher than themselves - to the idea of Rome itself.
AID00126759	In Rome I found a template for a society equal to the challenges of the post-apocalyptic world - a society that could and would survive.
AID00126760	A society that could prevent mankind from fracturing and destroying itself in this new world, by establishing a new Pax Romana.
AID00126761	It means a nationalist, imperialist, totalitarian, homogenous culture that obliterates the identity of every group it conquers.
AID00126762	Long-term stability at all costs. The individual has no value beyond his utility to the state, whether as an instrument of war, or production.
AID00126763	What does "Pax Romana" mean?
AID00126764	No, I'll destroy it because it's inevitable that it be destroyed. It's Hegelian Dialectics, not personal animosity.
AID00126765	So you'll destroy the NCR because you hate its inefficiencies?
AID00126766	How do I put this basically enough? It's a philosophical theory, the kind you might encounter if you took time to read some books.
AID00126767	The fundamental premise is to envision history as a sequence of "dialectical" conflicts. Each dialectic begins with a proposition, a thesis...
AID00126768	...which inherently contains, or creates, its opposite - an antithesis. Thesis and antithesis. The conflict is inevitable.
AID00126769	But the resolution of the conflict yields something new - a synthesis - eliminating the flaws in each, leaving behind common elements and ideas.
AID00126770	"Hegelian Dialectics?" What are those?
AID00126771	The bombs wiped the slate clean. Human civilization descended to a level of ignorance that effectively set our cultural progress back to zero.
AID00126772	The NCR has all of the problems of the ancient Roman Republic - extreme bureaucracy, corruption, extensive senatorial infighting.

AID00126774	Thesis and antithesis. The Colorado River is my Rubicon. The NCR council will be eradicated, but the new synthesis will change the Legion as well...
AID00126775	...from a basically nomadic army to a standing military force that protects its citizens, and the power of its dictator.

AID00141740	When fighting broke out, the Kings fought valiantly, but were no match for the armored killing machines, and were wiped out to the last man.
AID00141741	The Kings retained their control of Freeside, and while they continued to favor the needs of locals, they tolerated the citizens of the defeated NCR.
AID00141742	After their victory at Hoover Dam, Legion troops rolled through Freeside.
AID00141743	The Kings tried to fight back, but most were killed, and the rest fled into the wasteland.
AID00141744	VEndingJacobstown
AID00141745	With Jacobstown's leadership destroyed, the remaining Super Mutants and Nightkin of the west scattered across the wasteland.
AID00141746	Jacobstown withered away, its death going unnoticed by the rest of the Mojave.
AID00141747	Thanks to the Courier and Lily, a cure for the Nightkin schizophrenia was found shortly after Doctor Henry's experiment concluded.
AID00141748	Nightkin and other Super Mutants in the wasteland flocked to Jacobstown, and the town became known as a haven where a mutant could find peace.
AID00141749	Though a cure for the Nightkin schizophrenia was eventually found, it became a case of too little, too late for Jacobstown.
AID00141750	Disgruntled by the death of their leader, Keene, most of the Nightkin scattered into the wasteland, their insanity worsening with each day.
AID00141751	Jacobstown, constantly on guard for anti-mutant reprisals, never truly prospered.
AID00141752	Though a cure for the Nightkin schizophrenia was eventually found, it became a case of too little, too late for Jacobstown.
AID00141753	Most Nightkin at Jacobstown followed their leader Keene out into the wasteland, terrorizing the Mojave for years to come.
AID00141754	Jacobstown, constantly on guard for anti-mutant reprisals, never truly prospered.
AID00141755	It took more time than anticipated for a cure for the Nightkin schizophrenia to be found, but in the end it was beneficial to Jacobstown.
AID00141756	The presence of the Nightkin leader, Keene, persuaded Nightkin from across the wasteland to make the journey to the town.
AID00141757	Jacobstown prospered, becoming known as a fair - if somewhat intimidating - place for a trader to do business.
AID00141758	With no cure for the Nightkin schizophrenia in sight, the disgruntled Nightkin left Jacobstown. Without a treatment, their insanity grew.
AID00141759	The crazed Nightkin terrorized the wasteland, and Jacobstown suffered repeated reprisals from mutant-hating humans.
AID00141760	In the end, the surviving mutants abandoned Jacobstown entirely, its existence quickly forgotten by the rest of the wasteland.
AID00141761	VEndingGreatKhans
AID00141762	After generations of being beaten down, the Great Khans were finally broken by the Courier.
AID00141763	Those few who avoided the Courier's wrath moved north, into the wilderness of Idaho, where they tried once more to rebuild.
AID00141764	After the Second Battle of Hoover Dam, the Great Khans returned for a time to Red Rock Canyon.
AID00141765	The NCR's pressing need to expand proved greater than its promise of amnesty, and before long the government decided the Khans had to go.
AID00141766	The surviving Great Khans were relocated to an isolated, barren reservation, well north of NCR trade routes.
AID00141767	For supporting the NCR, the Great Khans were ruthlessly hunted down by the victorious Legion.
AID00141768	Caesar destroyed all evidence of their existence at Red Rock Canyon, and forbade mention of their name in any history.
AID00141769	The Great Khans' legacy was swiftly forgotten.
AID00141770	As reward for their loyal service, Caesar forcibly integrated the Great Khans into the Legion.
AID00141771	The sick and elderly were killed, the women sold as wives to ranking officers, and the tribe's identity was annihilated.
AID00141772	Though many Great Khans mourned the death of their tribe, many more were ultimately satisfied with their revenge against NCR.
AID00141773	After driving the Legion out of the Mojave Wasteland, the victorious NCR turned its attention to those who had allied themselves with Caesar.
AID00141774	The Great Khans were among the first tribes to suffer this fate, and the few who survived Hoover Dam were driven north, into the wilderness of Idaho.
AID00141775	During the Battle of Hoover Dam, the Great Khans quickly evacuated Red Rock Canyon and headed north and east into the plains of Wyoming.
AID00141776	There, they reconnected with the Followers of the Apocalypse and rebuilt their strength.
AID00141777	Bolstered by ancient knowledge of governance, economics, and transportation, they carved a mighty empire out of the ruins of the Northwest.
AID00141778	After their suicidal last stand at Hoover Dam, the Great Khans ceased to exist as a tribe.
AID00141779	The few surviving members dispersed, joining up with other tribes and gangs across the Mojave, and quickly forgot their heritage.
AID00141780	VEndingGoodsprings
AID00141781	Travelers continued to stop by Goodsprings Source for water on the Long 15, but rarely would anyone venture into the ruins of Goodsprings itself.
AID00141782	Those who did were almost always tourists, come to visit the graveyard where the Courier "rose from the dead."
AID00141783	Goodsprings saw more trade along I-15 after NCR gained control of the Mojave Wasteland, but with that came a heavy burden of the Republic's taxes.
AID00141784	Some old-timers, unable to handle the cost, were forced to move on, grumbling all the while.

AID00141788	Victor was a mixed blessing, however, as he continually monitored the town for Mr. House.
AID00141789	With New Vegas' independence formally declared, Goodsprings thrived.
AID00141790	More travelers stopped by Goodsprings on their way to and from the Strip, and the locals grew prosperous from the traffic.

AID00141913	VEndingVeronica
AID00141914	At odds with leadership over the Brotherhood's future, Veronica looked to the Mojave Wasteland for an answer both she and they could live with.
AID00141915	But the answer would never come, and the dangers of the world that had left the Brotherhood of Steel behind would eventually claim her life.
AID00141916	Hoping to lead the Mojave Brotherhood down a new path, Veronica sought to learn from the thriving cultures of the desert.
AID00141917	Absent a firm solution, Veronica's expression of frustration with Brotherhood leadership would lead to her banishment.
AID00141918	She ended her days a wandering tinker.
AID00141919	Despite her departure from the group, the Brotherhood's peace treaty with NCR came as some relief to Veronica.
AID00141920	Though she remained friendly with surface patrols, she was never again permitted to enter the bunker she once called home.
AID00141921	Fearing for the safety of anyone she associated with, she continued her solitary life as a scavenger.
AID00141922	But reports would emerge from Mojave scientists and social workers of old equipment miraculously repaired and research notes mysteriously completed.
AID00141923	Though she'd seen the writing on the wall, the destruction of the Mojave Brotherhood came far more suddenly than Veronica had expected.
AID00141924	The news devastated her. Despite her best efforts to leave her past behind, she found herself compelled to make one final journey to Hidden Valley.
AID00141925	There, she paid her last respects to the only family she had ever known.
AID00141926	The Brotherhood's open aggression along the New Vegas highways troubled Veronica greatly.
AID00141927	Nevertheless, it removed all doubt from her mind that in leaving them she had made the right choice.
AID00141928	Eventually she would take to the road, less in hopes of finding a new home than of leaving memories of the old one behind her.
AID00141929	The peace with NCR served to ease Veronica's worries about the Brotherhood's immediate future.
AID00141930	Still, a distance had arisen between her and her fellow members that would never be bridged.
AID00141931	She began secluding herself in crumbling libraries of the Old World, learning of promising technologies she knew the Brotherhood would never adopt.
AID00141932	The death of the Mojave Brotherhood came much too soon for Veronica, and in their absence, she felt truly lost.
AID00141933	Yet in its wake, she took small comfort in her decision to remain by their side through their few remaining days.
AID00141934	Veronica put her moral sensibilities aside and supported the Brotherhood's new campaign of aggression as best she could.
AID00141935	Yet deep down, she understood that it meant their end would surely be soon to follow.
AID00141936	VEndingLily

AID00141942	Encouraged by the Courier to stop taking her medication altogether, Lily's instabilities grew worse with each passing day.
AID00141943	Eventually she became little more than a ravening beast, the kindly old grandmother subsumed beneath the rage.

AID00141959	VEndingRex
AID00141960	He had survived police service in Colorado, the Great War, combat duty with the Legion, and being the companion of The King.
AID00141961	But, in the end, Rex finally succumbed to the horrors of the wasteland.
AID00141962	Having never received a replacement brain, Rex finally succumbed to old age, abruptly shutting down forever one quiet morning.
AID00141963	After two centuries of life and decades of service to humanity, Rex collapses and dies.
AID00141964	Revitalized by Violetta's brain, Rex eventually learned to balance the memories of his old life with Violetta's experiences among the brutal Fiends.
AID00141965	His mind had difficulty adjusting, but Rex eventually found peace with his new, more vicious self.
AID00141966	With the transplant of Lupa's brain, Rex gained all of the donor's experiences traveling with the Legion.
AID00141967	These melded well with his own memories of the Legion, and his new mind quickly adjusted to the myriad memories.
AID00141968	After Rey's brain was transplanted into Rex's cybernetic body, it took Rex some time to adjust to the old scrap yard dog's memories.
AID00141969	Eventually, Rex's mind settled peacefully, melding his own memories with that of long travels with Old Lady Gibson.
AID00141970	VEndingCass
AID00141971	Rose of Sharon Cassidy died as her caravan died - in an unmarked grave, another victim of the Mojave.
AID00141972	Despite the destruction of Cassidy Caravans, Cass lived for 30 more years.
AID00141973	She made her way back West and passed away in a small shack outside of Vault City, the rose pendant still around her neck.
AID00141974	The slaughter of the Van Graffs and the Crimson Caravan caused no end of trouble for NCR back West.
AID00141975	Already struggling, NCR's supply lines suffered further as the two caravans withdrew support until the "massacre in the East" was resolved.
AID00141976	In the years following the destruction of Cassidy Caravans, NCR used evidence of the plot to blackmail the Crimson Caravan and the Van Graffs.
AID00141977	NCR enacted strict trade laws with little resistance, strengthening their supply lines and their position in the Mojave.
AID00141978	Cass survived to see the NCR flag flying proud over Hoover Dam, and thought for a moment... this is what a hero must feel like.
AID00141979	Cass lived to see Hoover Dam in its Old World glory, humming with power the likes of which the Mojave had never seen.
AID00141980	Vegas burned brighter than ever, Securitrons filled the streets, and Cass's heart skipped... just a little.
AID00141981	Her last words were to the Dam - and to herself. "We were going full speed ahead... but facing backwards the whole time."
AID00141982	Cass lived to see the Courier bring down three armies and by her count, that was three more than she'd expected. She'd kept quiet about that, though.
AID00141983	Cass lived to see the mark of the Legion on Hoover Dam. Uncertain of what lay next for the West, she remained silent.
AID00141984	As the Legion marched West, she found it difficult to see the Dam as anything more than a gravestone for the Mojave - and everyone in it.
AID00141985	VEndingArcade
AID00141986	Though Arcade's intentions were pure and his goals were noble, he ultimately succumbed to the harsh brutality of the Mojave like so many before him.
AID00141987	Tricked by the Courier and imprisoned by the Legion, Arcade remained Caesar's personal physician for several years.
AID00141988	Caesar grew fond of speaking with such an educated man on philosophical matters. Arcade became his unwilling intellectual sparring partner.
AID00141989	After years of such servitude, during an unguarded moment, Arcade used a surgical scalpel and his bare hands to disembowel himself.
AID00141990	Lacking any other skilled medical personnel, the Legion was unable to prevent his death. Caesar mourned his loss for months.
AID00141991	Though the Legion was victorious at Hoover Dam, the Legate did not have the same medical needs as Caesar.
AID00141992	Lanius quickly tired of Arcade's acerbic wit and had the doctor crucified.
AID00141993	During the retreat of Caesar's Legion from the Mojave Wasteland, Arcade was a sad casualty, one of many.
AID00141994	His body was heaped with those of many others in a nameless ravine on the Legion's long march home.
AID00141995	Though Arcade had not hoped for an NCR victory, he was proud of his role in the defense of Hoover Dam against the forces of Caesar's Legion.
AID00141996	Unfortunately, when word spread that Arcade was once a member of the Enclave, he was forced out of the Followers of the Apocalypse.
AID00141997	Pursued by bounty hunters, NCR rangers, and the Brotherhood of Steel, Arcade pushed deep into the eastern plains and was never heard from again.
AID00141998	Arcade had hoped that Freeside would be able to remain independent of NCR rule, but he was glad that Caesar's Legion had been stopped at Hoover Dam.
AID00141999	He tended to the sick in Freeside for a while longer, then returned to NCR territory to become a teacher with the Followers there.
AID00142000	Though Arcade was crushed by the Legion's victory at Hoover Dam, he was not among NCR's casualties.
AID00142001	During the NCR's retreat from the Mojave Wasteland, he helped defend NCR citizens and refugees on their way to Mojave Outpost.
AID00142002	Unfortunately, NCR rangers identified his father's armor as Enclave property. He was arrested, tried as a war criminal, and imprisoned indefinitely.
AID00142003	When news reached Freeside that Legion forces were approaching New Vegas, Arcade did his best to help people escape with adequate supplies.
AID00142004	A Legion explorer saw Arcade helping locals escape and pointed him out to a Centurion.
AID00142005	Arcade's group was run down somewhere near Westside. There were no survivors.
AID00142006	Arcade was outraged by Mr. House's power play following the defeat of Caesar's Legion at Hoover Dam.
AID00142007	Though he remained in Freeside for a short time after the Securitrons established widespread control, he eventually traveled back into NCR territory.
AID00142008	Disillusioned with the Followers of the Apocalypse, he settled down in the outskirts of the Boneyard, where he worked happily as a family doctor.
AID00142009	Arcade was proud to have been one of the defenders who helped repel the Legion from Hoover Dam.
AID00142010	He was prouder still to see the area freed from the shackles of the NCR and Mr. House.
AID00142011	Though independence for New Vegas was not all he hoped it could be, Arcade used his Enclave knowledge and technology to keep order wherever he could.
AID00142012	Arcade was tending to the locals of Freeside when he learned that Caesar's Legion had been defeated and NCR was being pushed out of New Vegas.
AID00142013	Though he found that independence for New Vegas was not all he hoped it would be, Arcade did his best to help the locals govern themselves.
AID00142014	Though Arcade was proud to have been one of the defenders who turned back the Legion at Hoover Dam, he was crushed by Mr. House's ascent to power.
AID00142015	Saddened by the loss of life and liberty in the area, Arcade left the Mojave Wasteland for parts unknown. He was never heard from again.
AID00142016	VEndingBoone
AID00142017	Tired of waiting for the world to be done with him, Boone ventured into the wastes to make his own way out.
AID00142018	Unable to clear his mind of the past, he was at last granted the death he'd awaited, bringing final rest to a life that had ended long ago.
AID00142019	As the Battle of Hoover Dam ended, Boone confirmed what he had always suspected - that revenge would never quiet his troubled mind.
AID00142020	Side arm in hand, he journeyed back to California in search of the NCR officer who had led the attack on Bitter Springs.
AID00142021	There, with only two bullets loaded, Boone did the only thing he believed would put an end to his suffering.
AID00142022	Looking for a place where he could be of some use, Boone found himself re-enlisting with his old unit.
AID00142023	Though his regrets remained in his thoughts, they coalesced into a purpose, and Boone embraced it.
AID00142024	He spent his leave time hunting down slavers in the desert, his First Recon beret the last thing they never saw.
AID00142025	Though NCR was withdrawing from the region, Boone remained in New Vegas, finding work as a security guard and caravan scout along the highways.
AID00142026	While he might've preferred rejoining his old unit, Boone couldn't bring himself to abandon the city where he'd met his wife.
AID00142027	Boone refused to take the Legion's victory lying down.

AID00142029	And though the price on his head rose to levels unheard of, few pursued it, fearing it would be the last thing they'd never see.

AID00147087	War. War never changes.
AID00147088	When atomic fire consumed the earth, those who survived did so in great underground vaults.
AID00147089	When they opened, their inhabitants set out across the ruins of the Old World to build new societies, establishing villages, forming tribes.
AID00147090	As decades passed, what had been the American southwest united
AID00147091	beneath the flag of the New California Republic, dedicated to Old World values of democracy and the rule of law.
AID00147092	As the Republic grew, so did its needs. Scouts spread east, seeking territory and wealth in the dry and merciless expanse of the Mojave desert.
AID00147093	They returned with tales of a city untouched by the warheads that had scorched the rest of the world - and a great wall spanning the Colorado River.
AID00147094	The NCR mobilized its army and sent it east, to occupy Hoover Dam and restore it to working condition.
AID00147095	But across the Colorado, another society had arisen, under a different flag.
AID00147096	A vast army of slaves forged from the conquest of 86 tribes - Caesar's Legion.
AID00147097	Four years have passed since the Republic held the dam - just barely - against the Legion's onslaught. The Legion did not retreat.
